name: Tomato
description: Tomatoes are one of the most popular homegrown vegetables. They thrive in warm climates and need plenty of sunlight. Great for salads, sauces, and more.

care.water: Water regularly, keep soil consistently moist

name: Carrot
description: Carrots are root vegetables that grow best in loose, sandy soil. They’re rich in vitamins and easy to grow from seed.

care.water: Water frequently to keep soil moist
care.spacing: 2-3 cm (1 inch) apart, thin after germination

name: Lettuce
description: Lettuce grows quickly and is perfect for containers or garden beds. Harvest leaves as needed for salads and wraps.

care.soil: Moist, well-drained soil rich in organic matter

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumbers are vining plants that need support to grow vertically. They’re fast growers and produce crisp, refreshing fruits.

care.water: Water deeply once or twice a week
care.spacing: 90-120 cm (36-48 inches) apart or vertical trellis

name: Bell Pepper
description: Bell peppers thrive in warm climates and come in a variety of colors. They require a long growing season and consistent watering.

name: Spinach
description: Spinach grows quickly and can be harvested young. It’s a cool-season crop packed with nutrients like iron and vitamins.

care.water: Keep soil moist; don’t let it dry out

name: Zucchini
description: Zucchinis are prolific producers and grow quickly in warm conditions. Their large leaves need space to spread.

care.water: Water deeply once or twice a week

name: Green Beans
description: Green beans are easy to grow and come in bush or pole varieties. They produce crunchy pods perfect for steaming or sautéing.

care.water: Water regularly, do not let soil dry out

name: Radish
description: Radishes are among the fastest-growing vegetables. They’re great for beginner gardeners and add a spicy crunch to meals.

care.water: Water frequently to keep soil moist

name: Broccoli
description: Broccoli is a cool-season crop with edible flowering heads. It needs space and patience, but it’s highly nutritious.

care.water: Water consistently, do not let soil dry

name: Eggplant
description: Eggplants are heat-loving vegetables that grow glossy purple fruits. They need a long growing season and well-drained soil.

name: Kale
description: Kale is a hardy leafy green that thrives in cooler temperatures. It’s packed with nutrients and can be harvested multiple times.

care.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy

name: Beetroot
description: Beets are grown for both their roots and greens. They grow best in cool weather and are rich in antioxidants and nutrients.

name: Cauliflower
description: Cauliflower produces compact, edible heads and prefers cool weather. It’s sensitive to heat and drought but worth the effort.

name: Onion
description: Onions are versatile vegetables grown from seeds, sets, or transplants. They require a long season and well-drained soil.
